content.description: <math alttext="5 F e with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus M n O 4 with a negative one charge, aqueous, plus 8 H with a positive one charge, aqueous, reacts to produce, 5 F e with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus M n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 4 H 2 O liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MnO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Mn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Which of the following represents the oxidation half-reaction based on the balanced ionic equation shown above?

choices.label: <math alttext="F e with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus one electron, reacts to produce F e with a positive 3 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Fe with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, reacts to produce, F e with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus one electron" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M n O 4 with a negative one charge, aqueous, reacts to produce, M n with a positive 2 charge, plus 5 electrons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MnO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Mn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M n O 4 with a negative one charge, aqueous, plus 5 electrons, reacts to produce, M n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Mn</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Mn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Fe with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, reacts to produce, F e with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus one electron" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
